|wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = Mini PCI |exp_minipci_num = 1 |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.2.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = SerComm |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/17/2006 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = SerComm YBW10A |rad1modif = Mini PCI |rad1chip1 = Marvell;88W8361P;88W8361P-BEM1; |rad1chip2 = Marvell;88W8060; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The FCC test report lists the processor as a 333 MHz Marvell 88F5180n, RAM as 32MB, Flash as 4MB, and switch as the Marvell 88E6061. The wireless module has "970YBW0000-1.0MM" silkscreened on it in the FCC photos.
As shipped, the wireless module is a [[SerComm]] device, board ID YBW10A-1.0MM. :This mini PCI card has device ID [11ab:2a02]. Assumed 2x3 MIMO configuration. Then native software also allows this device to be easily configured as a simple Wireless Access Point and Ethernet Switch, without the routing and firewall services. *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=24356 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] - boot log, states CPU is a 88F5181 running at 500MHz. There does not appear to be any port of OpenWRT and such to the F5D8231-4 v2, but the mini PCI card might be re-purposed, to convert an old notebook computer to wireless N, leaving the center receive-only antenna connector open. Native Windows device drivers can be found at [http://sciencespaces.com/search/PCI%5CVEN_11AB--ds--DEV_2A02/3/ Sciencspaces]. While no native Linux driver ever made it all the way into the mainstream kernel, the card will also work with the Linux [http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Belkin_F5D8001v2 ndiswrapper]. [[Category:English Documentation]]
